abstract.p: Advertising: Leo Burnett to Form He

block.p: Leo Burnett USA in Chicago said yesterday that it would form a unit devoted to consumer health care advertising named LeoHealth, with more than 45 employees and billings estimated at $150 million from clients like Pharmavite, for Nature Made vitamins, and Procter & Gamble, for brands like Metamucil and Pepto-Bismol.

Leo Burnett USA in Chicago said yesterday that it would form a unit devoted to consumer health care advertising named LeoHealth, with more than 45 employees and billings estimated at $150 million from clients like Pharmavite, for Nature Made vitamins, and Procter & Gamble, for brands like Metamucil and Pepto-Bismol.

Toby Sachs, 46, senior vice president and director for new business at Burnett USA, was named to the additional duties of heading LeoHealth as chief executive. LeoHealth will draw on the resources of Burnett, part of the Burnett Worldwide unit of B Com3 Group, as well as sibling B Com3 agencies like Medicus, the Starcom MediaVest Group and Williams-Labadie. Other specialist units at Burnett handle tasks like urban marketing and marketing aimed at Spanish-speaking consumers.
